metadata.title: CVE-2020-14697 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Security: Privileges). Supported versions that are affected are8.0.20 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover ofMySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 7.2 (Confidentiality, Integrity andAvailability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14697` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-router - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.21-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
